verses.verse: These are also proverbs<WH4912> of Solomon<WH8010>, which the men<WH582> of Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> copied out<WH6275>.
It is the glory<WH3519> of God<WH430> to conceal<WH5641> a thing<WH1697>: but the honor<WH3519> of kings<WH4428> is to search out<WH2713> a matter<WH1697>.
The heaven<WH8064> for height<WH7312>, and the earth<WH776> for depth<WH6011>, and the heart<WH3820> of kings<WH4428> is unsearchable<WH2714>.
Take away<WH1898> the dross<WH5509> from the silver<WH3701>, and there shall come forth<WH3318> a vessel<WH3627> for the finer<WH6884>.
Take away<WH1898> the wicked<WH7563> from before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>, and his throne<WH3678> shall be established<WH3559> in righteousness<WH6664>.
Put not forth<WH1921> yourself in the presence<WH6440> of the king<WH4428>, and stand<WH5975> not in the place<WH4725> of great men<WH1419>:

For better<WH2896> it is that it be said<WH559> unto you<WH5927>, Come up here<WH8213>; than that you should be put lower in the presence<WH6440> of the prince<WH5081> whom your eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200>.
Go not forth<WH3318> hastily<WH4118> to argue<WH7378>, lest you know not what to do<WH6213> in the end<WH319> there<WH7453>, when your neighbor has put you to shame<WH3637>.
Debate<WH7378> your cause<WH7379> with your neighbor<WH7453> himself<WH1540>; and disclose not a secret<WH5475> to another<WH312>:
Lest he that hears<WH8085> it put you to shame<WH2616>, and your infamy<WH1681> turn not away<WH7725>.
A word<WH1697> fitly<WH212> spoken<WH1696> is like apples<WH8598> of gold<WH2091> in pictures<WH4906> of silver<WH3701>.
As a earring<WH5141> of gold<WH2091>, and a ornament<WH2481> of fine gold<WH3800>, so is a wise<WH2450> reprover<WH3198> upon a obedient<WH8085> ear<WH241>.

As the cold<WH6793> of snow<WH7950> in the time<WH3117> of harvest<WH7105>, so is a faithful<WH539> messenger<WH6735> to them that send<WH7971> him<WH7725>: for he refreshes the soul<WH5315> of his masters<WH113>.
Whoever<WH376> boasts<WH1984> himself of a false<WH8267> gift<WH4991> is like clouds<WH5387> and wind<WH7307> without rain<WH1653>.
By long<WH753> forbearing<WH639> is a prince<WH7101> persuaded<WH6601>, and a soft<WH7390> tongue<WH3956> breaks<WH7665> the bone<WH1634>.
Have you found<WH4672> honey<WH1706>? eat<WH398> as much as is sufficient<WH1767> for you<WH7646>, lest you be filled with it<WH6958>, and vomit it.
Withdraw<WH3365> your foot<WH7272> from your neighbors<WH7453> house<WH1004>; lest he be weary<WH7646> of you<WH8130>, and so hate you.
A man<WH376> that bears<WH6030> false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> against his neighbor<WH7453> is a maul<WH4650>, and a sword<WH2719>, and a sharp<WH8150> arrow<WH2671>.
Confidence<WH4009> in a unfaithful man<WH898> in time<WH3117> of trouble<WH6869> is like a broken<WH7465> tooth<WH8127>, and a foot<WH7272> out of joint<WH4154>.
As he that takes away<WH5710> a garment<WH899> in cold<WH7135> weather<WH3117>, and as vinegar<WH2558> upon soda<WH5427>, so is he that sings<WH7891> songs<WH7892> to a heavy<WH7451> heart<WH3820>.
If your enemy<WH8130> be hungry<WH7457>, give him bread<WH3899> to eat<WH398>; and if he be thirsty<WH6771>, give him water<WH4325> to drink<WH8248>:
For you shall heap<WH2846> coals of fire<WH1513> upon his head<WH7218>, and the Lord<WH3068> shall reward you<WH7999>.
The north<WH6828> wind<WH7307> brings forth<WH2342> rain<WH1653>: so does an angry<WH2194> face<WH6440> a backbiting<WH5643> tongue<WH3956>.
It is better<WH2896> to live<WH3427> in the corner<WH6438> of the housetop<WH1406>, than with a brawling<WH4079> woman<WH802> and in a wide<WH2267> house<WH1004>.
As cold<WH7119> waters<WH4325> to a thirsty<WH5889> soul<WH5315>, so is good<WH2896> news<WH8052> from a far<WH4801> country<WH776>.
A righteous<WH6662> man falling down<WH4131> before<WH6440> the wicked<WH7563> is as a troubled<WH7515> fountain<WH4599>, and a corrupt<WH7843> spring<WH4726>.
It is not good<WH2896> to eat<WH398> much<WH7235> honey<WH1706>: so for men to search<WH2714> their own glory<WH3519> is not glory<WH3519>.
He<WH376> that has no rule<WH4623> over his own spirit<WH7307> is like a city<WH5892> that is broken down<WH6555>, and without walls<WH2346>.
